meanings.def: a building or part of a building where you can buy goods or services
examples: to open/close/run a shop
There's a good selection of local shops.
a record/pet shop
a shoe shop
(British English) a butcher’s shop
(North American English) a butcher shop
(British English) I'm just going to the shops. Can I get you anything?
in a shop She works in a shop in the town centre.
He was alone in the shop when the robber came in.
shop owners in the area
I went around all the shops but I couldn't find a present for him.
Mobile shops are invaluable to people in rural areas.
She opened a flower shop in the High Street.
She works part-time in a shop.
The brothers opened a chain of electrical shops in the eighties.
The post office is at the end of the row of shops.
The shop offers a large selection of leather goods at reasonable prices.
Your local pet shop should stock a variety of different collars.

meanings.def: a place where things are made or repaired, especially part of a factory where a particular type of work is done
examples: a repair shop
a paint shop (= where cars or other items are painted)

meanings.def: an act of going shopping, especially for food and other items needed in the house
examples: I do a weekly shop at the supermarket.

meanings.def: a school subject in which students learn to make things from wood and metal using tools and machines
a room in a house where tools are kept for making repairs to the house, building things out of wood, etc.

examples: New restaurants are appearing all over the shop.

meanings.def: not neat or tidy; not well organized
examples: Your calculations are all over the shop (= completely wrong).

meanings.def: a person who is careless, or who moves or acts in a rough way, in a place or situation where skill and care are needed
examples: You’re not going to go storming in there like a bull in a china shop, are you?
The factory closed its doors for the last time in 2009.
The company closed shop and left the US last year.

meanings.def: to be in charge of something for a short time while somebody is away
examples: Who's minding the shop while the boss is abroad?
an area where many artists have set up shop
Some buskers had set up shop outside the station.

meanings.def: to close a business permanently or to stop working for the day
to talk about your work with the people you work with, especially when you are also with other people who are not connected with or interested in it
examples: Whenever we meet up with Clive and Sue they always end up talking shop.
New restaurants are appearing all over the shop.
Your calculations are all over the shop (= completely wrong).

shop for something to shop for food

meanings.def: to choose and buy things, especially online
examples: to shop the store/collection/sale
Shop our pick of the best platform boots here.
Scroll down below for ideas and shop your sneakers without wasting any time.

meanings.def: to spend time going to shops and looking for things to buy
examples: There should be plenty of time to go shopping before we leave New York.
‘Where's Mum?’ ‘She went shopping.’
She told her parents she was going shopping with friends.

meanings.def: to give information to somebody, especially to the police, about somebody who has committed a crime
examples: He didn't expect his own mother to shop him to the police.
